fields.Title: Ethnographic Assessment of Cupule/Pit and Groove Features: for Celebration Park Cupule Stone Report
fields.Description/Abstract:
(working)
Boulders and rock faces with cultural markings called cupules and/or pit and groove petroglyphs can be found on the Snake River Plain, the Great Basin, and a wide variety of habitats and time periods. A 'cupule boulder' originally located near Celebration Archaeological Park has been placed in the park. This paper provides an ethnographic overview of these unique cultural features to provide reference information for the archaeological analysis of the Celebration Park boulder and others on the Snake River Plain.
Description of Partner:  Research report is funded by State of Idaho Parks and Recreation grant and written in partnership with Celebration Park staff.
Role:  Principal
